page.title: 01Tennyson Country
page.content: The area is a fertile one of hawthorn enclosed undulating fields, streams & deciduous woods. The land combines chalk, clay & sand & is crossed by a network of well used public footpaths. Mixed farming is the main industry & is practised by five large landowners & ten smaller farmers who are the main employers in the area. Other work is found at the Abbattoir, Nursing Home & Woodyard in Tetford. Since Dutch Elm Disease much County Council & private replanting of soft & hard woods particularly in 1973 is already beginning to have an effect. Private planting has been mainly for game cover, namely pheasant. The older dwellings are generally small & built of local red brick & pantile roofs.
